intro: Laplacea pubescens var. camelliifolia, commonly known as the Camellia-like Laplacea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, camellia-like flowers that are typically pink or red. The plant features hairy foliage and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
